initial_story:
The winner of a Xiangqi, or Chinese chess, tournament has been stripped of his title after allegations of inappropriate behaviour.

Yan Chenglong has also been accused of cheating by using a communication device analogous to anal beads.

The 48-year-old has been stripped of his title and banned from playing for a year.

However, the Chinese Xiangqi Association (CXA) says it's impossible to prove accusations of cheating.

Xiangqi has been hugely popular across Asia for hundreds of years.

According to the CXA, Mr Yan started drinking with friends in his hotel room shortly after winning the title of "Xiangqi King" at a national tournament held on the Chinese island of Hainan last week.

He then defecated in the hotel bath in an act "that damaged hotel property and violated public order and good morals", said the CXA statement.

The CXA was forced to address rumours circulating online that Mr Yan had cheated using anal beads equipped with wireless transmitters to send and receive signals.

"Based on our understanding of the situation, it is currently impossible to prove that Yan engaged in cheating via 'anal beads' as speculated on social media," the CXA said.

As punishment for bad behaviour, Mr Yan was stripped of his title and banned from playing for a year.

The association did not disclose the amount of prize money Yan was forfeiting, but Xiangqi tournaments often promise winners tens of thousands of yuan (thousands of dollars), according to AFP.

Once upon a time, there was a kingdom where everyone was encouraged to lie. Sounds crazy, right? But that's just how things were in this kingdom.

So the next time you're tempted to lie, remember the lessons learned in this kingdom. Honesty may not always be the easiest path, but it's the one that will lead you to a brighter future.

Once upon a time, in a faraway kingdom, there lived a young princess named Rapunzel. She was blessed with long, flowing hair that shone like gold in the sun.

Rapunzel was locked away in a tower by her wicked stepmother, who was jealous of her beauty. The tower had no doors or windows, so the only way Rapunzel could see the outside world was through the tiny peephole in the ceiling.

One day, a handsome prince happened to be riding by and noticed the tower. He was curious about what was inside, so he decided to climb up the tower.

When Rapunzel saw the prince, she was instantly smitten. She fell in love with him and asked him to take her away from the tower.

The prince agreed, and together they planned their escape. But as they were about to leave, Rapunzel's stepmother found out and turned the prince into a frog.

Rapunzel was heartbroken. She spent the rest of her life in the tower, dreaming of the prince and wishing she could be with him.

But one day, the prince returned to the tower and transformed back into a human. He had been searching for Rapunzel all along and was finally able to find her.

Rapunzel and the prince were reunited, and they lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there lived a beautiful princess named Rapunzel. Her long, flowing hair was the envy of all who saw it, but alas, she was locked away in a tower by her wicked stepmother.

Rapunzel spent her days alone, gazing out the window at the world beyond. She yearned to feel the wind in her hair and the sun on her face. But her stepmother had other plans for her.

One day, while Rapunzel was cleaning the tower, she noticed a tiny crack in the wall. Curious, she peered through it and was amazed to see a handsome prince riding by on his horse.

Rapunzel's heart leaped at the sight of him. She knew that he was her only chance at escape. But how could she get his attention?

She thought and thought, but eventually, she had an idea. She began to sing, her beautiful voice carrying through the air. The prince heard her song and was instantly captivated.

He followed the sound of her voice until he found himself at the foot of the tower. "Princess Rapunzel," he called out. "I have come to save you."

Rapunzel's heart soared. She had found her prince! Together, they hatched a plan to escape from the tower and live happily ever after.

But as they were making their escape, Rapunzel's stepmother caught them. In a fit of rage, she cast a spell on the prince, turning him into a frog.

Rapunzel was heartbroken. She had lost her chance at happiness. But she refused to give up.

She searched high and low for a way to break the spell and turn the frog back into a prince. And finally, after many trials and tribulations, she succeeded.

The prince was returned to his human form, and they were finally able to live happily ever after. The end.

"Sorcerer Merlin," she called out. "I have come to rescue you."

Merlin was overjoyed. He knew he had found his savior. Together, they hatched a plan to escape from the cave and live happily ever after.

But as they were making their escape, Merlin's stepmother caught them. In a fit of rage, she cast a spell on the woman, turning her into a dragon.

Merlin was heartbroken. He had lost his chance at happiness. But he refused to give up.

He searched high and low for a way to break the spell and turn the dragon back into a woman. And finally, after many challenges and trials, he succeeded.

The woman was returned to her human form, and they were finally able to live happily ever after. The end.
